frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a Name to refer to an Entity.

This frame involves a static (primarily spatial) relationship between a Location and a Theme, in which the Theme is located in many or all subregions of the Location, and is thus construable as covering it.
A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier. ''

A Factor affects the outcome of an Undertaking, which  can be a goal-oriented activity or the maintenance of a desirable state, the work in a Field, or something portrayed as affecting an Interested_party.
A concept, Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, Concept_2 by means of some evidence.
A Concept_1 is related to Concept_2 by some Evidence.
frameExamples: They corresponded frequently and at length, exchanging intimate letters in which he <t>addressed</t> her as Windflower.
Making services <t>accessible</t> to those with special needs is expensive.
Temperature is the most <t>critical</t> factor in successful storage.
The single remaining piece of evidence <t>linked</t> Kirov the tailor to Kirov the dissident activist.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who uses the <fen>Name</fen>  to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The entity that is designated by the <fen>Speaker</fen> with the <fen>Name</fen> used.
The linguistic form used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The point of time or interval when the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Name</fen>.

The <fen>Theme</fen> in this frame is the object which is described as standing in some spatial relation to a particular <fen>Location</fen>.  <fen>Theme</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument or, with passives, as a PP Complement headed by 'with' or 'by'.
<fen>Location</fen> is the entity or area with respect to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s spatial arrangement is described.  This frame element generally occurs as an NP Object.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.
An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
<fen>Factor</fen> is used for the concrete or abstract entity whose importance is assessed.
The <fen>Undertaking</fen> is a process or state or field of activity in which the <fen>Interested_party</fen> has a stake.
<fen>Interested_party</fen> identifies the people who are affected by a particular <fen>Factor</fen>.
A <fen>Factor</fen> may be generally important to the people or the activities in a field of endeavour.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important to the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.  Generally expressed as the external argument.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.  Generally expressed as a PP complement.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.
The phenomenon that points to or proves the connection between <fen>Concept_1</fen> and <fen>Concept_2</fen>. Generally expressed as an external.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The Lord, who was charmed by her beauty,</fex> addressed her as 'than kaadhali!' (My darling) and hence the name.
And that's the reason why we called <fex>him</fex> 'Tom' when his real name was actually John.
A male voice answered the call, and Jones addressed the man as <fex>'Johnny.'</fex>
No one had <fex>ever</fex> called her 'my lady'.
<fex>Being sure they are buying fresh food</fex> is important to most people.
Temperature is the most critical factor <fex>in successful storage</fex>.
Being sure they are buying fresh food is important <fex>to most people</fex>.
A successful GATT round is important <fex>for the world economy</fex>.
High death rates among smokers connect <fex>cigarettes</fex> with disease.
Skid marks on the street connects my neighbor's car <fex>to my broken mailbox</fex>.
Ample evidence is able to connect <fex>the two</fex>.
